p.style: margin: 0in 0in 0.0001pt; text-align: left;

span.style: font-size: 12pt; z-index: 251659264; position: absolute; left: 393px; top: -21px; width: 109px; height: 49px; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;

p.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Cambria, serif; text-align: justify;
margin: 0in 0in 0.0001pt; text-align: left;

span.br:
Students, Parents, and Community:
I am pleased to announce that a contract for High School Principal of Blair has been offered to Mrs. Tammy Holcomb. Mrs. Holcomb is looking forward to leading Blair High School's tradition of being Nebraska's top performing high school in academics, fine arts, and activities.
Mrs. Holcomb is currently the High School Principal at Centura Public Schools. She has worked at Centura Public Schools as principal since 2011. Prior to that she had been a High School Principal and Fine Arts Director at David City.

span.span:
There were 21 applicants for the position. A selection committee interviewed three (3) finalists on Thursday, April 9, 2020. Mrs. Holcomb will assume the duties beginning July 1, 2020.
I want to thank the selection committee for their involvement in the process. I also want to thank students, parents, teachers, school board members, and community stakeholders for their input. 114 surveys were completed sharing input that was used to assist the selection committee to develop questions and choose candidates to interview who most closely match the skills, characteristics, qualities, and traits students, teachers, parents, and the community are looking for in the next principal. 46% of the respondents were parents and 18% of the responses came directly from the students.
Thank you again for your support in assisting BCS to carry out the important task of selecting the next High School Principal.
Sincerely,
Randall Gilson, Ed.D.
Superintendent of Schools
